thread.title: Scorpions fall in home finale
thread.title_full: Scorpions fall in home finale - San Antonio Express-News

author: Staff report
title: Scorpions fall in home finale
text:
Current
The San Antonio Scorpions closed their 2015 home season with a loss to the New York Cosmos 2-1 on Sunday at Toyota Field.
The match was moved to Sunday from Saturday because of torrential rain that trigged flash floods in San Antonio.
Billy Forbes scored in the 43rd minute off an assist from Omar Cummings to give the Scorpions a 1-0 lead going into halftime.
But in the second half, the Cosmos retook the momentum and scored in the 61st minute off a penalty kick from Marcos Senna and in the 78th minute off a penalty kick from Ayoze.
The Scorpions close the 2015 NASL season Saturday at Minnesota.
